etymologies: early 17th century: from Latin postumus ‘last’ (superlative from post ‘after’), in late Latin spelled posth- by association with humus ‘ground’

definitions: occurring, awarded, or appearing after the death of the originator

examples.text: he was awarded a posthumous Military Cross
a posthumous collection of his articles

shortDefinitions: occurring, awarded, or appearing after death of originator

definitions: (of a child) born after the death of its father

examples.text: Newton was the posthumous son of an illiterate yeoman

shortDefinitions: born after death of its father
